intro: Eritrichium confertiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower erithrion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, open habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms in the spring. Eritrichium confertiflorum is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
